titleStmt.title: A politike discourse most excellent for this time present: composed by a French gentleman, against those of the League, which went about to perswade the King to breake the allyance with England, and to confirme it with Spaine
Discours politique, tres-excellent pour le temps present. English.
titleStmt.author: Marquino, Francesco.

titleStmt.title: A politike discourse most excellent for this time present: composed by a French gentleman, against those of the League, which went about to perswade the King to breake the allyance with England, and to confirme it with Spaine
Discours politique, tres-excellent pour le temps present. English.
titleStmt.author: Marquino, Francesco.

notesStmt.note: A translation of: Gentil-homme francois. Discours politique, tres-excellent pour le temps present.
Translator's note "To the discrete and vertuous reader" signed: Francis Mar., i.e. Francesco Marquino.
Running title reads: A discourse of the league, betweene France and England.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
